description: '''Mbube''' is a form of [[Culture of South Africa|South African]] vocal music, made famous by the South African group [[Ladysmith Black Mambazo]]. The word ''mbube'' means "[[Lion]]" in [[Zulu (language)|Zulu]]. Traditionally performed ''[[a cappella|acappella]]'', the members of the group are male, although a few groups have a female singer. In this form, groups of voices singing homophonically in rhythmic unison are employed to create intricate harmonies and textures.
